item.title: Corner of Kentish Town Rd & Camden Gardens, 24th June
item.description:
I can't report via the tree section, it wants me to choose the location of the tree, but your website thinks it doesn't exist. The tree is completely blocking the pavement and you have to walk into the road to get past. This happens every Summer - the foliage at ground level needs completely cutting back.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53-55, Camden Gardens, Kentish Town, London

item.title: Road markings faded, cars always dangerously pulling out or failing to signal., 24th June
item.description:
Coming from Bellenden road, the one-way road (Chadwick Road) turns on to Lyndhurst Way. Cars very often fail to signal when they are going straight on down Chadwick Road, putting cyclists following the road round at risk – twice I've seen people knocked off their bike living here. Pedestrians are also at risk crossing Chadwick Road, as cars presume there is no need to signal. Every day there are near misses or aggressive honking here, because what to do on the road isn't clear. Repainting the markings, and adding some more signage will help clarify how to use the junction safely.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 97, Lyndhurst Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet
